nodes.bodyText:
The term 'link' is less known to user, it is AMQP  term, we should avoid it. The user should know that they are getting lock to the session.
Acquires lock for next available session and ....
Updated

When client calls acceptNextSession :  it should go to service bus and get a lock to any session and if client do not do receiveMessages() on it, the session is locked, no one else can get it.  Can you try that ?   getActiveLink() returns  a Mono and until a user subscribe to it, it will not create link.
According to our discussion discussion offline, we give the user a Mono so they have full control.

Once user have accepted a session, their receiver is locked to one session (named or unnamed) . And if they call receiver.receiveMessages() two times parallelly , what should happen ? There will be two subscriber receiving from same link. These two subscriber will get duplicated messages. We can check in dotnet, if they are throwing exception while one subscriber is receiving and do not allow second receiveMessages () ?
According to our offline discussion, we give the user full control over how many times they subscribe. But we return the same Flux instance if they call the async receiveMessages() twice.
Should we?
No, we don't allow peeking into a session that is not owned by this client.
latest update: removed these sessionId-related APIs because ServiceBusReceiverClient doesn't support multi-session any more.
nit: consistent use of final.
Updated.
nit: consistent use of final.
Good catch. Fixed
Can use map instead of .thenReturn
Updated
This looks exactly the same as the lines above, can we condense this into a private method?
It's actually slightly different. Anyway this getReceiverClient has been removed
Is this idempotent? If we call close multiple times, what happens.
This calls the ServiceBusClientBuilder's close() method.
Add documentation about what it throws if there is no session to accept. Same with async one.
Added
Add documentation about what the mono throws if there is no session to accept or this is locked. Same with other overload.
Added
Where are the unit tests for Session receiver?

Add documentation to specify what happens if the requested sessionId is not available.
Added a description
This API can be hidden for now until we decide that this is required. We can consider adding this post GA.
Removed it.
Update javadoc.

@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+package com.azure.messaging.servicebus;
+
+import java.time.Duration;
+import java.util.Objects;
+
+/**
+ * The builder that creates session-related {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} instances.
+ * Use {@link #acceptSession(String)} to create a {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} that is tied to a known specific
+ * session id.
+ * Use {@link #acceptNextSession()} to create a {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} that is tied to an unknown
+ * available session.
+ * Use {@link #getReceiverClient(int)} to create a {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} that
+ * process events from up to maxConcurrentSessions number of sessions.
+ */
+public class ServiceBusSessionReceiverClient implements AutoCloseable {

+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+package com.azure.messaging.servicebus;
+
+import java.time.Duration;
+import java.util.Objects;
+
+/**
+ * The builder that creates session-related {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} instances.
+ * Use {@link #acceptSession(String)} to create a {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} that is tied to a known specific
+ * session id.
+ * Use {@link #acceptNextSession()} to create a {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} that is tied to an unknown
+ * available session.
+ * Use {@link #getReceiverClient(int)} to create a {@link ServiceBusReceiverClient} that
+ * process events from up to maxConcurrentSessions number of sessions.
+ */
+public class ServiceBusSessionReceiverClient implements AutoCloseable {

nodes.bodyText: Why do we need operationTimeout as ctor arg. We can include this in the accept*Session APIs.
According to our latest offline discussion, we'll keep this operationTimeout on client.
This can be now removed because the processor can be created from the builder.
Remvoed
Fixed
Java guidelines specify that if the input is null for an expected non-null value, then we must throw NPE. If the input is invalid, then we should use IllegalArgumentException.
Updated to throw separate errors.
If this client is tied to a single session only, then why do we even need to have the sessionId in the method args?
Removed these session related APIs
Do we have a tracking GH issue for this task?
This has been removed.

        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             *        Use {@link #acceptNextSession()} to acquire the lock of the next availabe session
          
          
            
             *        Use {@link #acceptNextSession()} to acquire the lock of the next available session
Fixed.
None of these validations are required if we remove the sessionId param from all these methods. A client is tied to a single session only.
Removed

nit: Closing paragraph tag

appears twice.
Fixed

AmqpException can be thrown for many reasons - not just when the session is locked by another receiver. So, you can make this generic and mention that if there was an error while accepting the session.
Add @ServiceMethod annotation for all public APIs
Added to ServiceBusSessionReceiverAsyncClient and ServiceBusSessionReceiverClient.
Add @ServiceClient annotation to both sync and async clients.
Added

Updated
Make this package-private instead since this method will be used by the processor.

nodes.bodyText: All of this will be required for the session processor. Keep this code and make this available only for the processor.

I added maxConcurrentSessions back at package level but keep isRollingSessionReceiver deleted from the builder because ReceiverOptions.isRollingSessionReceiver() can be inferred from it's own properties.

For the async client, we just hid these overloads by making them package-private. In sync client, we are deleting these overloads. We should be consistent by either deleting in both clients or hiding it in both clients.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -260,20 +244,6 @@ public ServiceBusReceivedMessage peekMessageAt(long sequenceNumber) { return asyncClient.peekMessageAt(sequenceNumber).block(operationTimeout); } - /** - * Starting from the given sequence number, reads next the active message without changing the state of the receiver - * or the message source. - * - * @param sequenceNumber The sequence number from where to read the message. - * @param sessionId Session id of the message to peek from. {@code null} if there is no session. - * - * @return A peeked {@link ServiceBusReceivedMessage}. - * @see Message browsing - */ - public ServiceBusReceivedMessage peekMessageAt(long sequenceNumber, String sessionId) {

nodes.bodyText: Processor will never build a sync client. So, this method can be removed.
Since the async client built for processor will always have autoComplete enabled, the boolean param is redundant and can be removed.
This timeout is for a single attempt, right? If the user has set retry policy to 3 attempts, will this not wait for the 2nd attempt after the first attempt fails due to timeout?
